label: 朝堂院
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [The Chōdōin (also Hassōin), stood] in the south center of the Greater Palace, separated by an open plaza from Suzakumon Gate.  [It] had been created to provide facilities for early morning deliberations in the Imperial presence, monthly reports to the sovereign by the assembled bureaucrats, Accession Audiences, New Year Congratulations, the reception of foreign envoys, and other occasions of moment (p. 836). [八省院、朱雀門] [HW]
